Posts.Content: Jun 20, 2009 12:04AM LynnW wrote: I've got my pooper scooper ready and waiting.  On Wednesday this will be something that happened yesterday. huggs and prayers   Lynn
Posts.Title: STUPID BRAIN! DARLENEDENISE EGAL

Posts.Content: Dec 24, 2008 06:27AM - edited Dec 24, 2008 06:28AM by LynnW Hi Renee Ive taken so far chem when I first got breast cancer. Both sides removed with reconstruction ,, implants.  Not very comfortable. Then radiation,, then arimidex for 3 years. Came back in the bone so we tried Flasodex for 3 months. There was progression ...two small 8 mm spots on my liver and my neck has palpatable pea like lymph node involvement on the right side.  We are now going to do the taxotere,, but it seems like nothing is working. I'm not Her + but I am Er and Pr +.  Had my ovaries removed and genetic testing which stated 80% negative for the BRC1 gene.  But,,, my mother had breast cancer and passed 20 years ago. at the age of 46. I'm 46 now.  Frankly it seems like it was meant to be. I do try to stay positive as much as I can but lately,, last few months,, my joints have ached so bad I can barely climb out of bed. I've quit work and am laying around now,, hoping stress free living would help the pain,, but all it does is remind me I'm no longer productive. We are hoping the taxotere will help slow things down and make me feel a bit better.  Last week I had a shot of something to bring up my Hemogloban. But it hasn't kicked in yet. I'm actually taking 1/2 bottle of the 5 hour energy stuff that everyone is gulping down lately. It helps me stay away at night instead of sleeping on the sofa at 8:00 pm.  I'm so grateful for all your input here about the chemo.  I expected hair loss like last time and I felt awful the last time about 3 days after,, but I was on CEF so maybe a bit different.  I've gone and picked out my wig. Real hair this time. They cut and style it on Saturday. Then I think I'll just go ahead and shave my own hair off and get it over with. Some people have mentioned anti depressants. I think I'll ask my family doc about them,, but I feel the only thing that will help my depression is to get well. lol  You know what I mean?  I wish the joint aches would vanish. My oncology nurse mentioned the flasodex and bone building stuff would cause it too,, but I didn't take my last flasodex shot so don't know why its worse. Would the cancer affect my joints like this. Even  my wrist as I type is painful. Warm shower helps in the morning but I fear the day when I won't be able to get to the shower at all. This is scarey stuff.  Your all so brave and have such a great outlook. I'm learning from you and there is safety in numbers here I think. Not a good place to have safety in numbers but it does help.  ttyl Huggs and merry christmas to everyone. Lynn
Posts.Title: Taxotere, word of the day LynnW Reneepals

Posts.Content: Jun 10, 2009 10:26PM - edited Jun 10, 2009 10:26PM by LynnW Thankyou everyone for your input to my topic.  Im only on number 8 for treatments of taxotere and wondering if I should take a break.  The thing is last scan showed the slight improvement so now I'm afraid if I stop for a month or so that things will progress.  I feel like a weigh scale.  Which side is out weighing the other.  My oncologist started me on Flasodex when the cancer came back.  i was on Arimidex for 4 years so they weren't sure the hormonal thing was the way to go.  I stayed on the Flasodex for three months,,, they re scanned and two tiny spots appeared on my liver. Before that it was only in my bones.  Does that mean the Flasodex failed me?  I'm only getting chemo now and I don't understand why I don't get something to stop the estrogen too since I'm er and pr ++ So many questions... geeesh.  I also have slight lymphodema in my right hand again after six months where I was ok.  I blame it on gardening without gloves. My bad.  Its only the back of my hand and a bit in my forearm but it gets me down that something else is haunting me.  I want a peaceful summer. I just can't decide how to do it.   I can't beleive some of you have had 24 chemo sessions.  Does it continue to get rid of some cancer.  If so its worth it and I'll keep plugging on but hope that a break won't hurt me that much. thanks for listening Lynn
Posts.Title: Scans say stable. I say big deal. LynnW Dollyd

Posts.Content: Jun 19, 2009 11:58PM LynnW wrote: They had me on Arimidex for 4 years even though I had no ovaries.  I guess that was for the adrenal gland production of hormones and bone.  It obviously didn't work though. lol  The oncologist doesn't have me on anything except taxotere. Should I be on an anti hormonal.  I tried Flasodex but got progression after 3 months so I started the taxotere. Lynn
Posts.Title: Scans say stable. I say big deal. LynnW Dollyd

Posts.Content: LynnW wrote: Its funny in a way that my last scans a week ago say that the taxotere has gotten rid of one of the two spots on my liver.  My bone scan has stayed the same since February so now I hear the new word in the cancer clinic,,, "stable".  They want me to stay on the Taxotere since it seems to be helping.  I came home thinking I'd be happy but its a double edged sword.  The chemo makes me feel like I'm dieing for about a week or so. The drug they say is working is something I hate, so how do I feel happy that its worked and I will continue on it. What a crazy mixed up life I''m living.  I feel almost like an old dog that someone is nursing along just so the family can still say they have a dog. They won't put it down. My best friend is going through that right now with her pet.  All of these chemo mixtures is buying me time,, but for what end.  I guess so my husband still can see my body laying on the couch. And so my kids can still ask if I have any money for them. lol  Its inevitable that this disease is going to take me out,,, but I feel like I'm suffering with the looming knowledge....... and its just a matter of when.  It somehow seems  cruel,, and I felt almost angry when the oncologist told me the so called good news. Don't worry, ,I'm on anti depressants. lol  I just needed to share this odd feeling I'm having and I feel understood here more than anywhere. I should feel lucky.  Its the old phrase is the glass half full or half empty. Huggs all and be well Lynn Lynn Dx 2/9/2005, ILC, 6cm+, Stage IV, Grade 3, 13/29 nodes, mets, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Scans say stable. I say big deal. LynnW Dollyd

Posts.Content: Jun 2, 2009 09:53PM LynnW wrote: Hi Diane. I know that Flasodex has worked for some,, but I was on it 3months when they first told me that cancer was back.  I chose it becasue I didn't want to jump into chemo again as they told me it would be chemo forever.  I was devistated. Some ladies here have had good luck with Flasodex. My canacer was Estrogen and Progesterone positive so they hoped it woud do something but it didn't and the cancer progressed from my bone to my liver. I look back and sometimes think I shouldnt have been so frightened of the chemo,, but if I had it to do all over again I would make the same decision because QOL was important to me. We never know until we try.  What works for some doesn't for others and it makes no sense.  This is why cancer is so hard to find a cure for I guess. Huggs and good luck to you all. Thanks for all your words of support and understanding. Lynn
Posts.Title: Scans say stable. I say big deal. LynnW Dollyd

Posts.Content: May 29, 2009 02:21AM LynnW wrote: I watched Farha's cancer story last week.  I think that has put me in this mentality that i'm in.   She kept going and trying and suffering,,, but in the end all the words stable and under control etc meant very little. I know she's still alive but could she still be alive without all of that poison and pain. One wonders.  I am grateful that I was diagnosed 4 1/2 years ago. Unlike her as its only been two years. But I look at it that she's getting it all over with quickly where as mine is dragging out slowly but to the same end. Some people enjoy the time they are receiving.  Maybe thats the difference. For me aach day is frightening and its a struggle to look forward to the next.  I get small joys from time to time but they are over shadowed by the fact I won't have them for many many years.  Mary your story of 10 years is hopeful for us.  Wish i felt like I could keep going like this for 10 years but the reality is I don't feel like that and deep down I'm not sure i want to.   Dianne I too feel pathetic complaining when you can't even walk.  I suppose  for each of us this disease brings its own handicap. I can still drive and walk yet my fatigue has robbed me of daily things that I could once do. Its also caused depression and anxiety that weren't there before.  I've lost friends and freedom and that innocent naive attitude that made life feel like it was going on forever.   I'm glad I'm called stable,,, but pissed that it won't mean much in about 6 months.  Some people might think I'm negative. Actually i'm not. I'm realistic and i find that I won't be shattered when the next bomb drops.  Its my way of protecting myself I suppose.  I wish pain free days for all of my sisters.  Comfort is our goal here ,,, and the opportunity to laugh from time to time.  Maybe tomorrow I can come back on here and make you all laugh. Best wishes,, huggs,,, winks,, and thanks for understanding. Lynn
Posts.Title: Scans say stable. I say big deal. LynnW Dollyd

Posts.Title: Scans say stable. I say big deal. LynnW Dollyd

Posts.Content: Jun 18, 2009 11:12PM - edited Jun 18, 2009 11:14PM by LynnW Thanks Mary,, No they don't do tumor markers.  I asked one time why and she said just what you said.. They are not accurate.  My hand today is swollen as well my knuckles and my forearm a bit.  I rub it and try to wrap it but it never stays on properly.  I went last year for massage and it helped and was going to get measured for a sleeve for a trip i was taking but then the cancer came back and all the plans got lost in the shuffle.  I should go back to get the therapist to massage it back out and get the sleeve. I have breast surgery next wednesday for a reconstruction fix,, and so the massage will have to wait until after that.  Next monday is my next chemo.  I've had a week extra break since the surgery is scheduled,, but back at it as soon as its over. I'd like a longer break but afraid to take it..... in case of progression.  Its gotten rid of one spot on my liver and theres one more I'd like to have vanish.  My bone scan was stable last month as well.  You give me hope when you said eleven years at stage 4.  Way to go woman.  I wish I could follow in your footsteps but who knows.  psl. they stopped the Flasodex when chemo started because she said they weren't sure if it affected the chemo or not. hmmmm I should ask more questions.  I agree that I'm er and pr positive and the estrogen should be monitored.  I have no ovaries though. Huggs..Lynn
Posts.Title: Scans say stable. I say big deal. LynnW Dollyd

Posts.Content: LynnW wrote: Hi again Your likely all sick of my depressing messages. lol  I know I am. Today I went for the results of my re scans from 3 months ago. Since that short time where it was in my bones,,, apparently there are two tiny spots now on my liver, and the lymph nodes in my neck that I can feel,,, are cancer too. Taxotere. Thats the word of the day today. I start on the 29th of December.  Who here has taken this and was it effective??  I'm not sure what I'm hoping for here as far as dragging this thing out. Is it months,, or a year or two,, or unknown.  That word unknown is also popping up continuously. The only known thing is that I'm getting new symptoms every week.  How could this crap spread so quickly.  Its almost as though the scan itself initiates the whole process.  lol I wasn't as upset as I thought I'd be when the dr told me this today.  Its not that I don't care or have given up,, but I just feel its normal for all this to happen so its no big scare now. The scare is how and when to plan things. I'm going to go to the funeral home this month and talk about plans etc because I don't want my husband having to do it. Maybe its pre mature.. but i've read about  people going down hill fast and I don't want to wait until I can't drive etc.  Funny thing is today is my first day off work.  Husband bought a new camera for me to take pics of the pond and nature so I can paint again. I want to,,, I just can't today. He loves me so much.  He just wants me to "want" to stay alive so he keeps buying things. Like this new house,, the most amazing silver and black pre lit christmas tree, new furnishings... etc.    He's going to be heart broken when I'm gone and in the poor house as well. lol  I wish I could think more positively girls. My friends say how positive I am and I scratch my head and wonder who the heck are they talking about. I guess with them Im positive and on this site,, I'm negative. I think you guys can accept and understand where as they can't. Anyway its 1:30 in the morning, I guess its time to hit the hay and call it a day. Tomorrow is a new one and I"ll try to get through that without a tear.  This disease sucks.  I lost my mother to it... and know numerous others, but now that its me it sucks even more. Isn't that selfish of me. ?    Good night Lynn Dx 2/9/2005, ILC, 6cm+, Stage IV, Grade 3, 13/29 nodes, mets, ER+/PR+, HER2- Lynn Dx 2/9/2005, ILC, 6cm+, Stage IV, Grade 3, 13/29 nodes, mets, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Taxotere, word of the day LynnW Reneepals

Posts.Content: May 28, 2009 09:23AM LynnW wrote: Thanks girls. I should be thrilled that one of the microscopic spots on my liver is gone. But at the same time they've made me aware that this will never go away.  So really they should have said,, Lynn,, for now one of the spots is gone. Do you want to keep going and see if it does anything more. Klynn,, yes.  Tomorrow will be a new day.  I shall try to forget about all of this. Its hard because I just found out tonight that a girl that went to rads with me,,, has also got the news that its spread to her bone. She has only told her husband but not her son or family.  She emailed me and told me and hoped I didn't mind. lol I told her I don't mind.  I have stayed away from her on purpose becasue I didn't want to depress her and take away her hope.  I'm there for her now if she needs me. I also agree that family and friends just don't understand.  They would need the 4 year course I've taken in order to really understand.  I don't blame them for saying the wrong things.  But I definitely try to avoid them.  I haven't even returned calls.  Half of the people phoning have not called me in a year or more.  Seems hypocritical to me in a way. Now that I'm sick,,, they all want to get together. Ha,,ha,,  I keep telling them i just don't feel like it. Thanks for listening.
Posts.Title: Scans say stable. I say big deal. LynnW Dollyd

Posts.Content: Mar 17, 2009 01:00PM - edited Mar 17, 2009 01:01PM by LynnW Floridian,Its probably nothing but..... I had very dense breast tissue in both breasts and 6 years ago was told the mammo was ok but to keep getting checked every couple of years due to dense breast tissue.  I went back two years after that and both breasts had invasive Lobular Carcinoma,,, which had mimiced the breast tissue and had made the doctor think it was just normal tissue. I sat with this cancer for two years and by then it had traveled to my lymph nodes on both sides. I had a bilateral masectomy with reconstruction,, chemo,, radiation and armidex for 4 years.. then recently the cancer has returned to my bones. I'm not trying to scare you but I was in the same situation and if I had pushed them initially to check me further then the cancer may not have traveled so far and today I wouldn't be making end of life decisions.  Its no time to just take someones word for things.  Doctors make mistakes too.  My tissue was so dense the mammo would barely see through and had to have an ultrasound and then many biopsies of the whole two breasts to check suspisious areas.  Please please,, never think your being paranoid. Its your body,, its your life. Do whats best for you. Ask for an MRI because thats about the only thing that would have found my type of cancer. Good luck to you
Posts.Title: Help- Mom thinks I'm crazy? floridian floridian

Posts.Content: Mar 23, 2009 09:20AM LynnW wrote: What a lucky mother you have to have a daughter like you.  I often see women at the onc clinic with realatives and it must be such a warm reassurance for them to have someone there.  I want you to hang in there and keep doing what your doing. Its not pretty all of this,, but its also not the end of the road yet. Keep some hope and faith in you. huggs Lynn

I know this is another pot hole in the road you were traveling.  Hang in there because hope is all we can all cling to. huggs and kisses, Lynn

Kinda scared that chemo isn't kicking butt for me like I'd hoped.  Now that your on a plan  you can look to tomorrow and focus on healing.  Huggs and hope for you. Lynn
Posts.Title: Pet Results not good Bonnielv getwell

Posts.Content: Apr 22, 2009 01:38PM LynnW wrote: My mothers cancer went to her stomach and she took a drug that gave her 10 more years.  That was 20 years ago.  Hang in there and huggs to you
Posts.Title: Pet Results not good Bonnielv getwell

Posts.Content: Jun 2, 2009 10:02AM LynnW wrote: Angel,, i had lobular type cancer of my right breast 4 years ago and ductal on the left. Lobular seems to form flat areas of thickening and is very difficult to find.  Mammo can not see through it and 2  years earlier I was told I had fibrosistic breasts and to keep up with the mammo grams..  It was two years after that I had another mamogram because my nipple felt like a clothes pin was on it.  The nipple and aerola was aiming down ward too as if being pulled.   Still mammo could not see through it but the ultra sound worked a bit better. and so they sent me for biopsy. I had about 8 biopsies done ,, very painful.  Whole right breast turned black from bruising. Finally confirmed BC the ductal on the left breast had lobular features so they thought it was until pathology came back. Luck me. Two kinds of cancer.  By the time all of this was diagnosed I had 10 of 19 lymph nodes affected on the right and 3 of 10 on the left. Its now been 4 years and its come back to my bones.  I encourage you to keep doing research and get results.  I knew my body and deep down knew it wasn't right. I blame my doctor several years ago for mis diagnosing the fibrosistic disease.  Its seemed my cancer had been growing for quite some time. They say with lobular that an MRI is the best test to be done.Have you had one yet.  Best of luck,, lynn
Posts.Title: New info.... angeltam PS73

Posts.Content: Jun 20, 2009 12:06AM LynnW wrote: Who ever thought we would be dealing with brain surgery.  Sending positive energy to you Wendy. Speedy recovery and painless healing. Lynn
Posts.Title: WendyV needs our support katie11 heatherpalmerton

Posts.Content: LynnW wrote: Dear Husband. Thankyou for finding me 5 years ago and making a life for me when my life had been so hard. Thankyou for making me laugh daily and for being my best friend. Thankyou for accepting me the way I am and my boys the way they are. Yesterday we found out my cancer has come back in my bones.  I'm terrified but your love and concern has overwhelmed me. I remember you use to be such a selfish, and materialitic man. But now you've shown me your heart ....and that your love for me runs deeper than my skin,, or my hair,, or my ability to get around easily.  I feel like your right there with me. Just as scared,, just as hopeful and just as mad.  Your my cure for this disease.  And if it takes my life one day,, its you who made the journey a bit easier.   I know you will never read this because you don't go on these types of sites,, but I wanted to post it to show my sisters what a lucky woman I am and how I can breath a bit easier throughout this.  I will try to help you though your pain as well.  Its going to be ok,, I can feel it in my bones.:) Lynn Lynn Dx 2/9/2005, ILC, 6cm+, Stage IV, Grade 3, 13/29 nodes, mets, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply

Posts.Title: Signs of mets.. Lynette heatherpalmerton

Posts.Content: Sep 14, 2008 08:13AM LynnW wrote: I think I will show him someday. Right now we just cry alot. He wants to go back to the depressing oncologist and find out the nitty gritty details. Maybe get a second opinion and try to get so optimistic outlook.  We definitely need some hope to keep us going.Thanks Shirlann for the post about the long term woman. Its those things we need to hear.  Keep your chins up and we will all get through this somehow. Hugs  Lynn
Posts.Title: A letter to my husband LynnW Route53

Posts.Content: LynnW wrote: Hi Hope all u ladies are doing good. I have a question and not sure where to ask it.  Last few months my fingers have swollen up after mild use. can't really wrap fingers and so I asked my oncologist to set me up with a specialist.  They called back today to say they have to do an ultrasound first to rule out I suppose a reocuurance in the lymph nodes maybe.??  I had alot removed. If there is cancer there causing a blockage,, how would they treat it. they can't remove them. I'd have none left. Chemo again??  just wondering if this is common and wouldn't my whole arm swell up?  Its just my fingers a bit puffy and picky. thanks Lynn Lynn Dx 2/9/2005, ILC, 6cm+, Stage IV, Grade 3, 13/29 nodes, mets, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: swollen fingers LynnW LynnW

Posts.Content: Apr 6, 2009 08:54PM LynnW wrote: I had biopsies of both breasts,, and can't really remember much except they didn't use enough freezing and my teeth were chattering.  I cried. which isn't like me.  My whole right breast turned black and blue... more black.  I remember fearing that if it was cancer ,, that they had stirred it all up by doing so many biopsies.  scared me. When they did my mastectomies they made the incission along the spot where the biopsy was done,, in case any cells had landed there when they removed the long instrument.  Now i wonder even more if thats why I had 10 of 13 lymph nodes involved on the right side. The whole process was not memorable.  Keep us posted and hang in there.
Posts.Title: worried with these symptoms.. chekwa LynnW

Posts.Content: Oct 30, 2008 12:42PM LynnW wrote: update Well, my stomach settled down.(finally)  Still don't know what originally caused it.  I went to family doc and he is going to set up a scope of my stomach and bowel. Oh joy. He thinks maybe IBS. I started feeling alot better last week.  some of my old energy was back, No pain. On tuesday I thought to myself I hadn't felt that good since 4 years ago when all of this started.  Then I went home and continued to pack some boxes for our move on November 14th,, and then I got a bit tired. I layed down and my whole body started aching.  Joints,, back , legs head.  Like the flu but no fever. This continued over night and one tylenol 3 wouldn't touch the aches at all. The next morning I dragged my sorry body to work. but only lasted until noon.  I came home and doubled my tylenol  which pretty much put me out but got rid of the aches.  I continued every 4 hours with the tylenol had chattering teeth at one point which sounded like the flu but i'm still not convinced.  I slept ok last night and went to work today,, but I'm so tired and back still cramps up here and there where the cancer is.  I also started having pain in my opposite side rib on Saturday but I'm keeping a eye on it.  I used to get pain in the lower area of left rib cage years ago especially when I would breath so i'm hoping its the same thing and not that the cancer has spread over there.  If it did its extremely fast.  I'm so worried about all of this.  I know alot of you have dealt with this for years but the way my symptoms are right now it seems I'm deteriorating weekly.  How many times am I suppose to go the the doctor. If I do will they scan my again to see if its in my left rib.  ?? Got my records finally from the hospital.  Scan said extensive disperse met to lower mid and upper spine as well as pelvis and right 9th rib. No soft tissue involvement. doesn't sound very good does it. :(  I've had two treatments of Aredia and flasodex,, but not sure flasodex is the way to go. I don't want chemo but its the only thing they 've offered if this doesn't help.  5 rad treatemnts to my mid spine and pelvis.  I'm back this week to...... why me.?  Sorry to be so depressing.  It seems to be happening much too fast.  I know a woman who went 30 years with it in her bones here and there.  Her daughter keeps trying to re assure me but to be frank i think my case is much worse and she was very lucky to have only hot spots thoughout her years.   So,, I m not very optimistic right now.  Just worried that I'll be gone in 6 months.  Another worry is that since rads,, or maybe the flasodex,, when I try to have sex with my hubby,, its tender way inside. Its as though my parts are too small if that makes sense.  Could it be from dryness. I used K Y but the discomfort is way high inside. Thanks for listening and all your help girls. I'm a mess. Lynn
Posts.Title: got very nauseated from first radiation treatment LynnW LynnW

Posts.Content: Mar 25, 2009 10:54AM LynnW wrote: I think my oncologist is distant because of my dx and prognosis.  She's young and her nurse is my age and they always laughed at my jokes and loved my visits and its possible they don't want to get connected.  It must be hard for them to get to know us and then deal with losing us. I think I'd become disconnected too.  I find I'm doing this with friends too.  If they weren't my very closest friends,, I'm slowly gaining distance from them so that they won't hurt and neither will I.  Weird I know but thats what I've been doing to survive emotionally.
Posts.Title: patient-doctor relationship: your thoughts and experiences paige-allyson KerryMac

Posts.Content: Sep 16, 2008 07:31PM LynnW wrote: I'm going in tomorrow for my first bone strengthening treatment.  They apparenlty send me home with the I.V and someone at home pulls it out when its done.  I also get my injection of Faslodex hormone. I'm torn between taking Taxotere possibly first then switching to hormonal therapy.???  I was on Arimidex for the last 4 years and obviously it didn't work. Had my ovaries removed as well. Hubby is going with me and we are going to ask all of the questions I've come up with from your input. I've got a feeling he's going to be on their side with the chemo because he's afraid nothing else is going to help and I'm wasting time.  Two against one.. (not fare) lol You've all been a wonderful resource for what I should be asking.  I had a cruise booked for January and thought perhaps its ok to wait on the chemo but if they see alot of cancer on my spine,, perhaps thats why they are pushing it first.  My Onc said we'd try the hormone first if I wanted but her concern was it takes a while to show any result.    I'm so dam scared of all of this. One mistake on my part or my docs could be the last mistake.  I'll let you all know how it goes.  The way they've booked my vist I'll be there for blood work at 8:45,, then visit with doc at 9:30 then treatment of hormone and IV at 12:00 noon. Geez. I've had to book the whole day off work.   Cant seem to get a break anywhere. lol Keep you posted. Hope everyone is doing well Lynn
Posts.Title: I have Doctor Depressing,, I need your input LynnW Monique42

Posts.Content: Sep 14, 2008 05:09PM LynnW wrote: Thankyou for your encouragement. Its for sure the doctor I rely on to keep me alive isn't very encouraging. Maybe theres something I don't know. Maybe its so vast in my spine that its hopeless. Not sure,,, but husband wants to go in and get the dirty details and then suggest we get a second opinion.  He's mad that they haven't scanned me in 4 years nor taken blood work in 3.  Hell the last few visits they didnt' even weigh me. Just asked how I was feeling. Im in Canada, Perhaps the routine is different but they don't scan you yearly or anything here. They wait for symptoms.  But who knows what the symptoms are like.  I thought I had siatic back trouble like I have my whole life. Of course we are mad right now. Feel like we've been shoved to the side as I don't fit in anywere.  The chemo I'm leaving as a last resort. She wanted me to take it first.  I'm assuming its because things look grim but who knows.  Then she changed her mind and said she was on the fence about taking chemo and it was up to me?  Gee glad I have a doctor to help me throught this. Lynn
Posts.Title: I have Doctor Depressing,, I need your input LynnW Monique42

Posts.Content: Mar 12, 2009 11:39AM LynnW wrote: Chekwa,, just thinking of you and hoping the ultra sound was nothing
Posts.Title: worried with these symptoms.. chekwa LynnW

Posts.Content: Apr 1, 2009 12:41AM LynnW wrote: We will worry with you BJ. Huggs.
Posts.Title: worried with these symptoms.. chekwa LynnW

Posts.Content: Mar 23, 2009 01:33AM LynnW wrote: I had lower back pain that radiated down my legs like my old siatic nerve problem. We kept thinking that must be it as the nurse said the pain should be constant if it was met.  Mine wasn't really constant. It was on a few days then ok then back ,,, approx once per month of episodes.  Finally a rib was sore. That was my final assurance that it was met so at my next appt I told them and suddenly they wanted a bone scan and cat scan done.  Geeez someone finally took me seriously but by then it moved all over my back bone and pelvis and now in my neck in the lymph nodes.  Don't let the doc underestimate what your feeling.  If your worried then listen to your body and go get it looked at. Then you know where you stand. best of luck to you lynn
Posts.Title: Bone Mets Symptoms jdash mrs_X_Sunneedazee

Posts.Content: Sep 15, 2008 06:49PM - edited Sep 15, 2008 06:49PM by LynnW When my husband and I go back we'll ask why no biopsy.??? They did an x ray after the bone scan showed vertebrea activity. They also did more bone scan pics of my spine hip and pelvis Three days later I had a c-scan of internal organs as I've had stomach problems (feeling full quickly)  family doc is treating it as excessive stomach acid. No biopsy but I assumed the scans are reliable or else they wouldn't tell me its spread there. Thats taking quite a chance to just assume its spread.  I don't see how 1/2 of my spine could be infection or inflamation.  I have no pain lately but all summer had lower back ache. not severe,, just nagging annoyance. For sure I'll pressure doc to let me know why no biopsy and if Er an  Pr can change. Thanks for your advice girls. Lynn
Posts.Title: I have Doctor Depressing,, I need your input LynnW Monique42

Posts.Content: Sep 18, 2008 07:29PM LynnW wrote: Thank you for you kind words Maria About the red blood count thing.  Apparently by red blood count is 94 but my iron is good,, and within range.  Every heard of that? Lynn
Posts.Title: I have Doctor Depressing,, I need your input LynnW Monique42

Posts.Content: Dec 4, 2008 05:17PM LynnW wrote: Robin I envy your attitude.  Yesterday I felt better,, and I swear it was because I read all the nice posts here.  Today,,, I'm back to squeezing the lymph node in my neck and reading up on how deadly they are above the collar bone. The internet can be a curse you know. Too much info.  I want my life to go back to 5 years ago. I want to wake up tomorrow and this all be a dream. I can wish can't i ?? lol huggs to all
Posts.Title: Feeling like I'm going down hill LynnW Mabledw

Posts.Content: LynnW wrote: Hi Its been several weeks since I've posted. I've responded to some other posts and tried to keep my chin up and positive,, but since we moved into our new wonderful home,,, I'm feeling like I'm going down hill. To re cap,, I found out in August the breast cancer had spread to my back,, my pelvis and one rib.  I'm on Flasodex for the 3rd month and bone building IV,, then rescan next monday to see if its worked. I know it hasn't. The rib on the other side of my body hurt for 3 weeks. Same pain as the right side.  Two days ago my elbo felt like someone had banged it with a hammer... I know the feeling oh too well.  And for the last week or more I've noticed the bean sized lymph nodes on the right side of my neck more prominent.   I went to the family doc who is trying anti biotics for 10 days to see if its an infection. Large lymph nodes are usually your body trying to fight something off... but other than some mild head aches and ear plugged up,,, I haven't felt like I have been coming down with anything.  This is day 5 and the nodes are still the same.  I fear the cancer is moving everywhere. I also have had a head ache now and then. Not severe but more like when I shake my head it hurts.  Everything that hurts has me in a tail spin.  Today my bumb hurts. Its more than likely the pelvic bones,, but its annoying and adds to my constant discomfort. I'm taking tylenol 3 constantly.  One at a time... as I don't want to be asleep, but it doesn't seem to cut it much.  I will go back on the chemo they are offering but the doc says shes not sure if it will even help.   I'm tring to be positive for my husband and family but I feel like I'm just getting worse by the day. How could it travel so fast. after 4 years.The scans in August said it hadn't gone to any lymph nodes or vascularly,,, but only a few months later it feels like it has if its in my neck lymp nodes.   I'm so pissed and discouraged.  I'm putting in finally for disability so I don't have to crawl out of the house on cold winter mornings.  But even that feels like I'm giving up. Like I've taken that drastic step into the world of dieing. As long as I could carry on a normal life,, I felt like I was beating it. Now I don't.  I love my new home. God bless my husband for trying to make my life majical. Its a dream home and I can never re pay him for his love and support.  He's scared too. He wants me to feel good. He wants me to smile again,, so we can both forget for a moment,, but I just can't.  I'm too mad. I'm too resentful that this has taken my wonderful future. I'm sure everyone here feels the same way. I needed to vent and I'm sorry for dredging it all up.  Many women here helped me beleive that bone metastesis was more chronic than deadly.  But the last month I feel like its moved on and very fast. I don't want to give up but I don't know how to fight this. Thanks for listening. Huggs to all Lynn Lynn Dx 2/9/2005, ILC, 6cm+, Stage IV, Grade 3, 13/29 nodes, mets, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Feeling like I'm going down hill LynnW Mabledw

Posts.Content: Dec 2, 2008 10:48PM LynnW wrote: Thank you so much you wonderful brave women.  I will sleep more peacefully tonight. Tomorrow is another day.  I should be grateful for it. I will post more when I know more.  Tonight my husband said he would trade places with me. He doesn't want to be left behind without me.  He's so wonderful and loves me so much. I have to be strong for him. I keep forgetting that. Lynn
Posts.Title: Feeling like I'm going down hill LynnW Mabledw

Posts.Title: Feeling like I'm going down hill LynnW Mabledw

Posts.Content: Oct 17, 2008 10:14PM LynnW wrote: Hi ladies Its been a bit over a week since rads ended. Every day I have stomach cramps. I'm eating small amounts several times a day. No diharea right now.  Before rads I was getting once per week severe cramps and diharea,, so I'm glad its only cramps right now but its very exhausting. I seem to have alot of flatulence too. I saw a temp oncologist last week since mine was on holidays. He says to wait until I have another attack then go to emergency.  Says this isn't likely cancer since its rare it goes there and that I need a upper GI doctor.  I've made an appointment with my family doctor for Wednesday.  I will ask for a scope of my stomach. Thats all I can do I guess, I've lost 5 lbs in a month and its really worrying me. Thanks for listening to my whining. I just want to get better and worried its more serious. I'm also sleeping all the time. huggs Lynn
Posts.Title: got very nauseated from first radiation treatment LynnW LynnW

Posts.Content: Oct 5, 2008 12:04PM LynnW wrote: Good to know it will get better. I'm taking anti nausea pills,, which have helped,,  I'm discouraged because I didn't really need the radiation to begin with.  Only occasional stiffness and or pain in lower back.  But they offered rads for pain so I thought it would be a good thing.  Doesn't really get rid of the cancer so not so sure now why I've agree'd to it.  I have alot of gas gurgling in my stomach the last few months. Actually most of the summer.  I'm taking pills as well for too much stomach acid. (family doc prescribed)  Not sure if I have too much or not enough at this point...... but constant gurgling in my stomach and I'm hungry but then can't hold alot without gas and reflux.  Had cat scan of enitire intestine area and they said all was ok,, but now I'm freaking out because I'm losing weight due to this stomach issue. Bone metastesis,.,,, can that give me stomach problems??  Its all so confusing.  I need a doctors appointment every day. lol Thanks for you help Fitztwins Lynn Lynn
Posts.Title: got very nauseated from first radiation treatment LynnW LynnW

Posts.Content: Oct 11, 2008 02:18PM LynnW wrote: Hello I'm so lucky to have you guys ( I mean girls) I feel like someone is looking out for me. My husband I think is sick of me being sick lol I finished the rads on Wednesday. I took stepesit,, or something like that and Zofran each visit to control the nausea.  Thursday I was ok,, just a bit colicy. Friday "again" I woke up to severe stomach cramps and diharea started. It was yellow and mucus (sorry for the description)  By noon I was crying because Im very sick of this.  Maybe this time its from the radiation but I started getting these episodes last summer and then every week for the last 4 weeks.  I'm dragged out,, have lost more weight and not sure what to do. My stomach constantly gurgles and churns.  Sometimes I'm starving but then when I eat I can't hold my normal amount.  Doc gave me pills for excessive stomach acid a few months ago. I'm taking them,, but the weekly flu like symptoms have me worried. I've read up on my symptoms and it says things like Irritable bowel syndrome,, chrones,, etc.  I had a cat scan before the rads and doc never mentioned my stomach.  In fact I asked her and she said it was ok.  Could they have missed something?  Like pancreas (cancer) or some other organ causing too much bile.  I know gall bladder trouble is possible but no one has checked it. I'll talk to the oncologist Tuesday when I go back again for my faslodex injection. Then Wednesday for the bone building IV.   My hats off you all.  I hate practically living at the hospital.  I don't know how you all do it and keep your chins up for dummies like myself with all these problems. thanks so much.. P.S.  On Friday when I was sooo sick with severe cramps etc,,, my purebred ragdoll cat decided to have her kittens.  Felt like I had every contraction right along with her. What a day it was.  But,, she had 5 beautiful kittens. The beauty and miracle of life out weighs all my worry this week. :) Lynn
Posts.Title: got very nauseated from first radiation treatment LynnW LynnW

Posts.Content: Oct 5, 2008 09:47PM LynnW wrote: It continually gets harder to tell what is causing stomach issues.  I'm taking so many pills I can't keep up.  Tylenol 3 for flare up pain,, causes constipation.. so Im taking stool softener ,, as well I take pill for excessive stomach acid,, Can't drink water without reflux and burping. Taking stemisil for nausea due to the radiation.  geee gads.  I also take Immodium for the days when I have diharea,, like last week before starting rads had the stomach flu type symtoms. Next time I have the episode I'm going to emergency,, The cramps are so bad in the pit of my upper stomach that I have to count to get through them,, then vomiting a bit,, has kept me up till about 2:30 am.  ...and ususally diharea the next day or at the same time. I'm still working so its hard to deal with getting to work etc.  I feel so exhausted from being sick. Had this flu like thing twice in two weeks and it takes three days to recover from the stomach soreness.  Lately the bone metastesis is the least of my problems. Weird. Anyway, I hope the rest of you are doing better and get through any treatment you may be having. Huggs Lynn
Posts.Title: got very nauseated from first radiation treatment LynnW LynnW

Posts.Content: Oct 30, 2008 07:54PM LynnW wrote: Janice,, I can't beleive your on here giving "me" support. Your having a rough time of it yourself are you not? With treatment. I'm reading your posts because my next option is the dam chemo your on. I don't think I'd have the strength you do. LuAnn,, you as well.  Thanks so much for your advice and support. All of you ladies are likely feeling much worse than me.  I bow to you,, I really do. I carved a pumpkin tonight. That was my big adventure today after working 8 hours.  Hubby bought dinner from take out.  Now I'm pooped Night all
Posts.Title: got very nauseated from first radiation treatment LynnW LynnW

Posts.Content: Nov 10, 2008 04:49PM LynnW wrote: HI Bethie I'm not sure what a broke rib feels like. The rib on my right side definitely has cancer. Its not bothering me much... but for two weeks I've had some pain in the left side rib,, and I'm assuming it has spread there. I'm waiting to see if it goes away like the right side did because I don't want to be re scanned again and the whole hoopla,,, just for a rib. I'm on Flasodex and the bone strengthening IV each month but it must not be working. I've only had two shots but if its spread to the left side of my body,, it can't be much good. I'm now deciding to start chemo ,, that is if they say the Flasodex is not working.   They have mentioned Taxotere.  I'll take what there is but they don't know that it will work even. This is all so stressful. I don't know how you do it. Anyway I hope you are well. And I hope your rib is better.  I can' barely flip over in bed with my new found pain. But its ok during the day when I'm upright.  Tylenol 3 is about all they've given me for it. Take care and thanks for you information. p.s. I'll make sure I' don't lift anything heavy when we move. But its frustrating not to be able to help everyone. I think I'll start disability in the next few months. I don't know how some of you women work and deal with this. your hero's for sure. Lynn
Posts.Title: got very nauseated from first radiation treatment LynnW LynnW

Posts.Content: Oct 13, 2008 04:01PM LynnW wrote: Hi Luann I can't really describe this as acid relux. My stomach sounds like its full of churning acid. Friday afternood horrible knifing pains and diharea,  As of today intermittent cramps not as bad but make me know something is still there. This has been slowly happeing since July of this year. Started out as acid reflux and early satiety at meal time. Its grown in to this beast and I'm scared. Wouldn't a cat scan show something wrong with my stomach. They said it was ok. I can't deal with this. I'm still trying to hold down my job. Anyway,, i'll ask the doc about Nexium. I go in tomorrow for the faslodex. I have written up all my pills and symptoms  to take with me. Thanks for writing.  I'm feeling a bit better but no way near "normal" lol Lynn
Posts.Title: got very nauseated from first radiation treatment LynnW LynnW

Posts.Content: Mar 24, 2009 01:17PM LynnW wrote: Hi I know I'm not on the right board.  I have stage IV cancer and all they can do is slow it down. 4 years ago I was first  diagnosed with the initial bc and it had not spread yet. I had surgery, Reconstruction at the same time,, Chemo and the Rads.  I had to deal with 4 doctors.  Surgeon, Plastic Surgeon, Oncologist and Rad Onc. The Surgeon was from the pits of hell I think.  She had a cold stone face when she first met me. Hadn't even looked at my pathology yet so had to go and read then come back.  Gave me the grim news that it was "Bad".  Had gone to 13 lymph nodes,, both breasts involved, used words like agressive etc. There was not one word of hope.  I beleive hope is something we need and can't live without. Needless to say she operated and after my follow up I never returned to see her. My plastic surgeon was up beat,, and every obsticle we came across we worked together to make it work. Because the general surgeon knew I'd need rads,, she said the plastic surgeon would not likely continue with the expanders.  I was so let down but when I went to see the plastic surgeon he said,, we were going to try it anyway. What was the point in stopping.  He never let me give up, When I had radiation they told me the expanders had to come out due to the metal ports for filling.  I came up with an idea to remove and install different ones with a port that would rest down below my bra line on my side rib cage out of the field of radiation.  My ps agree'd it was doable,, and i was the first to have implants filled after rads and it worked. My rad oncologist was also more up beat and gave me the stats and if the cancer came back they would have new treatments and not to worry too much etc.  I liked her and enjoy seeing her each time I need to. Now to my Oncologist.  She and her nurse were very supportive and upbeat for the 4 years I appeared to be cancer free. Always telling me I was doing amazingly well, as I was high risk for cancer coming back. The tone seemed to change when last year I complained of back and rib pain and after scans they told me the cancer had come back.  They both sat there,,,, as if a new attitude had over come them. Telling me this was not going to go away,,, chemo forever,, etc,, etc, I was already devastated by the news being so bad,,, I don't think hearing the additional challenges with chemo was going to make me stronger. I became resentful of their new found vision of my case and wondered what happened to the happy friendly staff I had once known. Since then I've dealt with the news and i;m on chemo again,, and trying to cope but if it wasn't for my Family Doctor who I haven't mentioned yet.... I don't think I could have dealt and likely would have taken my own life. My family doctor spends an hour or more at each visit.  He goes over the treatment I'm getting and tells me if he approves or not.  His staff called me a few weeks ago at home to see how I was doing since the chemo hit so hard.  They told me he'd come to my home to viist.  I told them I'd drive in as I wasn't bed ridden yet.  I went in last week and he let me know he was on the pallative team in my area and he would make home visits if I needed it down the road,, and he explained that pain management was his main concern. We discussed depression issues and I asked for some medication which he gave me.  After I left I felt like a weight had been lifted and I was no longer in this thing alone with my medical team.  When things get ugly I know he'll be there for me.
Posts.Title: patient-doctor relationship: your thoughts and experiences paige-allyson KerryMac

Posts.Content: LynnW wrote: Well I'm joining this section finally after 4 years.  Found out yesterday my cancer is in my vertebrae 1/2 way up and my rib My oncologist ticked me off by sounding all negative.  I see posts on here that show productive living from women with this, yet my doc doesn't sound optimistic. Not saying much at all. Heres the scoop.  They have offered hormonal Faslodex montly injections and the biophosphatate IV monthly to strengthen bones. Not sure what one they will give. Will they give rads to my vertebrae?? even if theres no pain right now.  My rib was killing me but today its ok,, so do I still have it radiated? Its all so confusing. They also mentioned Taxotere, but started telling me I'd always be on it. What,, I'm suppose to agree to "forever" chemo.  Apparently they give me some for 4 months then re scan and if it helped I go off for a while,, then they stick me back on it again for 4 months. Bi weekly sessions. I opted to try the hormonal injection of Faslodex for now. I have a Caribbean cruise in January. I will take the Taxotere for 4 months when we get back,, but I told my family if it comes back again I won't keep going back on it.  Chemo makes me feel worse than the cancer. I can deal with hair loss temporarily and all the side effects but not when they tell me its going to be ongoing..  I did it before and I was ok but the thought of being on it forever as they are suggesting,,, really depresses me.  Is this normal treatment?  They didn't show me any scans etc. My other organs are fine so far. She said eventually it will spread to other organs.  I want to know where the positive Doctors are that can give a girl a tiny bit of hope.  My family has been in tears for two days.  I want to tell them theres some dam hope. Please help with this. Its too confusing at time like now.  I appreciate your feedback This hospital gave me no scans for 4 years. Now this has happened and I have a hard time accepting that they couldn't have warded it off before now or done something before it was 1/2 way up my back. Lynn Lynn Dx 2/9/2005, ILC, 6cm+, Stage IV, Grade 3, 13/29 nodes, mets, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: I have Doctor Depressing,, I need your input LynnW Monique42

Posts.Content: Sep 18, 2008 09:22PM LynnW wrote: Also wondering how long I'll feel crappy from the Faslodex and / or aredia? Flu like symptoms today. Had the medicine yesterday.  My butt bones hurt more today than before the treatment. Also extremely tired.  Could sleep all day. Lynn
Posts.Title: I have Doctor Depressing,, I need your input LynnW Monique42

Posts.Content: Sep 15, 2008 04:18AM LynnW wrote: You girls have to be the best medicine in the books.  I'd like to print all of this off and go show my doctor but then I fear she'll dump my case and I'll be searching for a new quack. lol When I had bilateral breast cancer 4 years ago all she and her nurse could say is how well I was doing etc.  Its like they took responsibility and pride that I was disease free for so long. I had extensive lymph nodes affected and they kind of expected me to have a reoccurance before now. It feels as though now that its come back,, they no longer feel this pride and are just sitting there both telling me how they are sorry etc... but not offering me any hope.  I realize its not curable. I realize they are only buying time but they kept dwelling on the chemo and how I could take a break from it for a while etc.  They are trying the faslodex for now only because I refused the repeat chemo treatments.  I feel like I may be making a mistake but after reading your posts I think I made the correct decision.  My girlfriends mother had bone met 30 years ago. 30 years and she's now 73. Never had one chemo treatment in her life.  Only rads and biophosphate injections.  My hat is off you you women and your strength.  I feel like a deer caught in the headlights. My hubby and I will go next week to book the injection of faslodex,, and then talk a bit more with doctor downer.  If my case is worse than others she should have explained that to me.  I feel like I have no control at this point.  Just sitting here waiting to crumble from a cancer ridden spine.  God,, a mechanic has more bedside manner in my opinion. P.s. good thought about the biopsy and the Er Pr changing. I may ask for that but I'll have to be put out for it.  I'm a scardey cat at any biopsies after my breast one caused so much pain years ago.  any more info is appreciated. Your all the best and I thank god I found this site 4 years ago. Wish I could help someone else like you've helped me. take care and hang in there huggs Lynn
Posts.Title: I have Doctor Depressing,, I need your input LynnW Monique42

Posts.Title: I have Doctor Depressing,, I need your input LynnW Monique42

Posts.Content: Apr 12, 2009 08:59AM LynnW wrote: The bothersome thing for me is that the end will come with or without the chemo.  We are buying time.  Do we buy time with a mixture that poisons us and leaves us like a zombie,, Or do we choose to slowly break down and end up like a zombie anyway.  I'm really bothered by this.  I think we have to cling to hope.  I've recently discovered that HOPE is what gives us some kind of QOL.  No matter how much pain we are in. If there is hope that something will work,, then we can endure alot of discomfort. Huggs
Posts.Title: Thinking about quiting chemo Lilac Godsgal

Posts.Content: LynnW wrote: Hi Its me again. Well I had my first radiation treatment last Thursday. Ironically on Wednesday night I had a re occuring stomach upset with cramps all night and some vomiting.  ON Thursday I mentioned it to the nurse before the rad to my spine and pelvic area as nausea can be a side affect.  She said to let them know if I did get sick. lol  Ya,, right. I went home after,, just got in the door and ran to the sink to throw up. Continued like that for several hours every 5 min of dry heaves. My stomach was already beat up from the night before.  I was a mess.  I had to go to work the next morning and heroically did 1/2 a day,, then came home and called the nurse. She appologized and they gave me some anit nausea drugs for that nights rad session.  It seemed to work.  I've got three more to go.  This is all for pain that I wasn't having too much of but thought Id get the radiation to help things out.  I feel like a mess lately.  I feel worse than when they told me this had spread.  Flare up pain today as well. Went to look at the new house and I felt like an invalid. My husband said he doesn't care if I'm only a head and nothing else. lol that he loves me for whats inside. I laughed that this may be all thats left of me. Just thought I'd update the treatments.  Oct 24 Flasodex and the bone IV again. Not too sure that could be causing my stomach issue too.   Reflux,, feel full fast.  Anyone else have these issues?? thanks for listening Lynn Lynn Dx 2/9/2005, ILC, 6cm+, Stage IV, Grade 3, 13/29 nodes, mets, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: got very nauseated from first radiation treatment LynnW LynnW

Posts.Content: Oct 17, 2008 10:13PM LynnW wrote: Hi ladies Its been a bit over a week since rads ended. Every day I have stomach cramps. I'm eating small amounts several times a day. No diharea right now.  Before rads I was getting once per week severe cramps and diharea,, so I'm glad its only cramps right now but its very exhausting. I seem to have alot of flatulence too. I saw a temp oncologist last week since mine was on holidays. He says to wait until I have another attack then go to emergency.  Says this isn't likely cancer since its rare it goes there and that I need a upper GI doctor.  I've made an appointment with my family doctor for Wednesday.  I will ask for a scope of my stomach. Thats all I can do I guess, I've lost 5 lbs in a month and its really worrying me. Thanks for listening to my whining. I just want to get better and worried its more serious. I'm also sleeping all the time. huggs Lynn
Posts.Title: got very nauseated from first radiation treatment LynnW LynnW

Posts.Content: Sep 18, 2008 02:48AM LynnW wrote: Hi  LuAnnH I think it was Adreia,, Sarted with an 'A' lol  I'm so tired and cranky right now I can't go look for the sheet.  I know it wasn't zometa.  They use the other one,, my onc told me. Took about 2.5 hours to get it in.  I took the I.V. out myself. Had the faslodex too today. My bumb is sore.  I'm not sure which one makes me achey and tired but I am. We talked to the oncologist in more detail today. My bone met seems to be in many vert up my lower back, and some areas of pelvis.. as well as one rib.  Because its extensive,, this is why they kinda hoped I'd opt for Taxotere first.  But we have agreed to give the Faslodex 3 months. They can't radiate my vertebrae either because its not one big tumour.  Its spread out.  Guess when pain time comes,, I'm outta luck for that area. I see the rad oncologyst on Friday morning. I guess I"m down in the dumps today more than normal.  I can't get this thing out of my head that I won't last very long.  You women are miracles you really are.  My red blood count is only 94 right now and is suppose to be around 120 so nurse said to eat some steak... lol  Isn't read meat bad for us?  I'm taking B12 on my own advice and will look up other things as well. I think I'd feel better mentally if I could find some energy.  Its  a vicous circle as I could be tired because im so stressed mentally. lol  Anyway,, I also asked about the biopsy.  She said because of my high risk for my bc spreading (many lymph nodes affected) and the scans etc they are certain its the same bc.  7% chance of the ER PR and herceptin changing. As well she is concerned about more issues trying to get some tissue in the areas,, than the status having changed.  Not sure why.  I didn't know it was in my pelvis too so that scares me even more.  My husband and I were trying to buy our dream home.  He wants to contine with it because he won't give up on me.  He wants me to quit work in Dec and start painting again.  So do I.  But I feel like I'm giving up normal life if I do that. No more work. Just disability.  I'm so confused.  I feel my body has let him down too. Sorry to be so depressed.  Must be the hormone needle. :(( Thanks for listening. big hugs :))) lynn
Posts.Title: I have Doctor Depressing,, I need your input LynnW Monique42

Posts.Content: Oct 30, 2008 12:16PM LynnW wrote: Many aches and pains are from nothing much at all.  I've had pains and issue in almost every part of my body.  People stared thinking I was a hypocondriac.  I had various symptoms for 3 years.  My original diagnosis was  4 years ago and I had surgery,, (bilateral) as well as  chemo, rads and then daily arimidex. The problem all this time was trying to distinguish side effects from various treatments and drugs with what could possibly be a  metastesis.??    I had joint aches,, back discomfort, fatigue,  I tended to beleive it was from being estrogen free. I had my ovaries removed on top of everything else when first diagnosed.  My oncologist also would swing in the direction that the aches and pains were from Arimidex,, or side effects of chemo years ago.  I went on my merry way.  4 months ago I decided to push for a bone scan or some sort of test since they did very little to me in all these years and my aches and pains had continued all last summer.  Well to make along story short the cancer had spread to my spine and pelvis as well as one rib.  I truely beleive that all the pain and problems I was having were from this and not from any side effect of a treatment.  Whats frustrating is that .. we aren't doctors.  We don't know whats the norm and what isn't and we rely on them to hear the alarms we might be sounding.  If I had to do it over again, I'd be making them re scan and re test me every time I feld something out of the norm.  Not that it would have changed my prognosis but they could have started their new treatments sooner and I would have avoided some of the discomfort I did have for so long. We shouldn't run to the doctor every time theres a pinch or an issue, ,but the rule of thumb is let it go for two weeks and if it doesn't get better,, then go to the doc and push for an investigation. Huggs and good luck to all of you ladies Lynn
Posts.Title: Damage 2 years on from chemotherapy. tigr HollyHopes

Posts.Content: LynnW wrote: Hi I've had the weirdest symptom lately.  When I shower and look down, the right hand side of my lower abdomen just above the pelvic bone..is puffier than the left hand side.  I have very little hair left in that area so its easy to see.  Theres no pain or redness.. just a puffy area. I can't feel a lump or anything hard and when I lay down it seems to disapear.  I read up on it and it sounds like a hernia possibly from being constipated from each Taxotere session.  I'm going to ask my family doc in a few weeks.  My first fear was cancer but its not in a location where it could cling onto. I have bone met and wondred if that was causing it, but theres no hardness of any kind. I've pushed and poked, and all it feels like is fatty tissue.   Has anyone had something like this. Its on the right side and I read that the bowel can prodrude in that area from straining.  hmmmm Lynn Lynn Dx 2/9/2005, ILC, 6cm+, Stage IV, Grade 3, 13/29 nodes, mets, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
